title: Musical Therapy
content: - Musical therapy is a clinical practice that uses music to address physical, emotional, cognitive, and social needs.
It can be used to improve communication, motor skills, memory, and emotional regulation.
Musical therapists are trained professionals who use music to achieve therapeutic goals.
image_desc: A musical therapist playing guitar with a patient
narration: Musical therapy is a fascinating and effective approach to healing and well-being. It uses the power of music to address a wide range of needs, from physical rehabilitation to emotional support.  Musical therapists are trained professionals who use music in a structured and intentional way to help individuals achieve their therapeutic goals.
